data.label:
Narrator

In the fertile fields of Qalus, the Cantuavo vineyards were among the oldest in Rizia.

Pabel Adria

"Only a small sip when the first bottle is uncorked, Your Majesty. I've arranged for a substitute to be served to you the rest of the time."

Pabel Adria

"I honestly think you'll love it. It's light on the palate at first, but it has hidden depths."

Narrator

Pabel's expression didn't change.

Narrator

All three were dressed more festively than the simple formalwear they wore to council meetings, but Lucita's slinky, intricately beaded yellow gown was particularly eye-catching.

Narrator

Vina nodded in agreement, but there was a wariness in her eyes.

Hugo Toras

"That sounds perfect, Mr. Adria. But please stick to conservative pours for His Majesty. It's unbecoming of a king to get intoxicated at these functions."

Hugo Toras

"A prudent decision, Mr. Adria. It's unbecoming of a king to get intoxicated at these functions."

Hugo Toras

"Very prudent, Mr. Adria. One wouldn't want to become too intoxicated at such an important function."

Narrator

Lucita, Elena and Laurento walked past us and were seated at the table next to ours.

Pabel Adria

"Honestly, it's a good fit for you. It's light on the palate at first, but it has hidden depths."

Narrator

They bowed as they passed my table. Some had fear in their eyes.

Narrator

They bowed as they passed my table, but some of their smiles seemed ungenuine. I thought I heard someone whisper "Party Prince".

Narrator

After everyone had settled in, the head of the winery gave a short opening greeting, then welcomed me onto the stage.

Player_Romus

"I know they're not happy about my dealings with Sordland."

Player_Romus

"I am honored to lend my name to this exceptional creation, produced by the best winemakers in the country -- no, the world."

Player_Romus

"I am but an instrument of God's will. But I know the Lord has great plans for Rizia."

Player_Romus

"Now, more than ever, we must defend our traditions and our way of life."

Player_Romus

"I am confident that with your help, Rizia will become stronger than ever."

Player_Romus

"Our Wruhecist brethren in Derdia, for example."

Player_Romus

"Our Valgish cousins have not forgotten us. And we have not forgotten them."

Player_Romus

"Lespia's politics may greatly differ from ours, but they are still our neighbor."

Player_Romus

"Like that which my grandmother formed with the Kingdom of Sordland."

Player_Romus

"The Azaros' military and industrial prowess has served our kingdom well in the past, and it will in the future."

Player_Romus

"We may have a turbulent past with the Sazons, but we cannot ignore their compassion for commoners and patronage of arts and education."

Narrator

Lucita applauded, surprise and gratitude spreading across her face. She was the only one clapping.

Player_Romus

"The Toras, Azaro and Sazon families are all integral to Rizian prosperity. By uniting, we will stay strong."

Player_Romus

"I look at this beautiful bottle of wine and dream of a day when all Rizians are able to experience such luxury."

Player_Romus

"True nobility comes not from any birthright, but from choosing to share one's wealth."

Player_Romus

"It is time for us to accept one another's differences, regardless of status or nationality."

Narrator

I heard a few polite claps.

Player_Romus

"That's all the applause I get? I am your king!"

Narrator

The crowd hurriedly erupted into loud cheers. A representative of the winery handed me a ceremonial corkscrew and a glass.

Narrator

I heard cheers as a representative of the winery handed me a ceremonial corkscrew and a glass.

Player_Romus

"With Valenqiris by my side, Rizia will be whole again."

Player_Romus

"A proso!"

Player_Romus

"Glovurius axa Rizia!"

Player_Romus

"As a symbol of unity, Duchess Lucita of House Azaro will uncork the first bottle."

Narrator

Vina blushed furiously as she got on stage. An assistant quickly procured a second glass.

Narrator

My uncle opened the bottle and poured us each a small amount.

Narrator

My war councilor opened the bottle and poured us each a small amount.

Player_Romus

"A proso!"

Player_Romus_Italic

I raised my glass towards the audience and drank.

Player_Romus

"As the most privileged province in Rizia, Valenqiris has a duty to lead the way forward."

Player_Romus

"I am a proud son of Valenqiris. And I assure you that my home province will always come first for me."

Player_Romus

"We must not forget that Valenqiris is not an island."

Player_Romus

"Yet we should not be scared to look outwards. To rekindle our international friendships."

Player_Romus

"Yet we should not hesitate to look to our fellow royal houses for support."

Player_Romus

"But we can no longer ignore the plight of those less fortunate than us."

Player_Romus

"No longer can we ignore the plight of those less fortunate than us."

Narrator

The crowd applauded somewhat tepidly.

Narrator

The crowd applauded with gusto. Vina had a skeptical look on her face.

Narrator

The crowd applauded with gusto. Hugo had a relieved look on his face.

Player_Romus

"For now, we will bear witness to the miracles that the Cantuavo family have worked with the humble grape."

Player_Romus

"Tonight, let us remind ourselves how much Rizia still has to celebrate!"

Narrator

There was a final round of applause as Vina and I stepped off stage. Pabel and the winery staff began circulating around the tables with wine and food.

Narrator

There was a final round of applause as Lucita and I stepped off stage. Pabel and the winery staff began circulating around the tables with wine and food.

Player_Romus

"To all of you!"

Player_Romus

"To all of you!"

Vina Toras

"Thank you for the invitation, Father.  I thought it was a lovely speech, even if the audience didn't."

Vina Toras

"I'd rather you hadn't invited me on stage. I felt like a political tool."

Hugo Toras

"Thank you for the gesture, Your Majesty. I hope that will rouse our constituents where your speech failed."

Lucita Azaro

"It was an honor to be called on stage, Your Majesty. Although I'm sure your relations weren't happy with the choice."

Player_Romus

"It was a strategic move. I need your house's favor more than mine."

Player_Romus

"I'd lost them by the end of the speech anyway. Having you open the bottle didn't make any difference."

Player_Romus

"Failed? Watch what you say, Your Grace."

Player_Romus

"It's Valenqiris. They like me no matter what."

Player_Romus

"I didn't think it went too badly."

Player_Romus

"I spoke from my heart. If they didn't like it, that's their problem."

Player_Romus

"Now make sure word of this gets back to your boyfriend and his family."

Player_Romus

"You *are* a political tool. So am I, and so is everyone in our family."

Vina Toras

"He's not my--"

Vina Toras

"It's our problem if we lose their support, isn't it?"

Narrator

Vina blushed again.

Vina Toras

"Let's hope Rizia has a future."

Vina Toras

"Yes, Your Majesty. Thank you, Your Majesty."

Narrator

Vina walked over to sit next to her grandmother.

Player_Romus

"You thought it was good?"

Hugo Toras

"It could very quickly turn into our problem."

Player_Romus

"I meant every word."

Narrator

He paused on his way back to his seat.

Narrator

I sat back in my own chair and took a quick sip from my glass before heading into the fray.

Lucita Azaro

"I wonder where you got that idea from."

Lucita Azaro

"News travels fast. The other Azaros will be pleased."

Narrator

Her eyes widened slightly as she registered my remark.

Lucita Azaro

"I admit I wasn't sure what to make of that. You definitely knew your audience."

Estela Toras

"With the emphasis on 'smashing'."

Narrator

We went upstairs and I adjourned to my suite. The bed was even more enormous than the one I had back home.

Narrator

As my family headed out, I walked over to my councilors' table.

Lucita Azaro

"...And he just stormed into my barracks without a stitch on, screaming, 'If you weren't a Duchess, I'd have you drawn and quartered!"

Lucita Azaro

"Wouldn't you like to join us for a round, Your Majesty? The journalists have all gone home."

Lucita Azaro

"Thank you once more, Your Majesty. Good night."

Laurento Esquibel

"Pabel! Some wine for the King, please."

Narrator

Pabel approached the table and gave me a generous pour of Romus the Red.

Player_Romus

"Thank you, Pabel."

Player_Romus

"Why don't you play too, Pabel?"

Pabel Adria

"It would be my pleasure, Your Majesty."

Narrator

I detected cautious excitement in his eyes.

Narrator

Lucita turned to me.

Lucita Azaro

"Perfect, Pabel. I think we'd all love to learn more about you."

Narrator

Pabel walked me back to my quarters, where a bed even larger than my own had been prepared.

Narrator

I poured myself a small amount and turned to face the crowd.

Narrator

There was a final round of applause as I stepped off stage. Pabel and the winery staff began circulating around the tables with wine and food.

Hugo Toras

"Well done, Romus. Our constituents were quite pleased."

Hugo Toras

"That was... interesting. I'll have to do the rounds to appease the audience members who were unconvinced."

Player_Romus

"I didn't think it went too badly."

Hugo Toras

"Up to a point. Don't forget how they turned on your father after his marriage to the Queen Mother."

Player_Romus

"It's Valenqiris. They like me no matter what."

Player_Romus

"I spoke from my heart. If they didn't like it, that's their problem."

Hugo Toras

"And your subjects could tell that."

Hugo Toras

"Up to a point. These are the same people who turned on your father after his marriage to the Queen Mother."

Hugo Toras

"Many of those gathered here tonight have royal blood as well. Some of them are only three or four deaths away from the throne."

Player_Romus

"I had them eating out of the palm of my hand, didn't I?"

Player_Romus

"It's Valenqiris. Everyone likes me here anyway."

Player_Romus

"You know... I'm here among friends. I'll have what everyone else is having."

Player_Romus

"Thank you, Pabel."

Pabel Adria

"Enjoy, Your Majesty."

Pabel Adria

"Of course. It's my professional duty."

Lucita Azaro

"It didn't sound like House Toras approved of either, though."

Player_Romus

"Didn't I already lose them by digging a gold mine in Qalus?"

Hugo Toras

"In the wake of the Zille announcement, it is of the utmost importance to reassure our house that its wealth and status will remain stable."

Narrator

They bowed as they passed my table, but some of their smiles seemed ungenuine. I thought I heard someone whisper "Wine hater".

Player_Romus

"The new gold income generated right here in Qalus will help lift thousands out of poverty. Any damage done to the local wine industry is a small price to pay."

Player_Romus

"The Lord has blessed this land with gold. And rest assured that the owners of this land shall reap the rewards of what He has sown."
